name: File

properties.name: alias
properties.description: If true, the object refers to a file system alias or shortcut.

properties.name: created
properties.description: The creation date of the referenced file, or null if the object does not refer to a file on disk.

properties.name: error
properties.description: A string containing a message describing the most recent file system error.

properties.name: exists
properties.description: If true, this object refers to a file or file-system alias that actually exists in the file system.

properties.name: fsName
properties.description: The platform-specific full path name for the referenced file.

properties.name: fullName
properties.description: The full path name for the referenced file in URI notation.

properties.name: absoluteURI
properties.description: The full path name for the referenced file in URI notation.

properties.name: relativeURI
properties.description: The path name for the object in URI notation, relative to the current folder.

properties.name: modified
properties.description: The date of the referenced file's last modification, or null if the object does not refer to a file on the disk.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The file name portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the path specification.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: The localized name of the referenced file, without the path specification.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The path portion of the absolute URI for the referenced file, without the file name.

properties.name: parent
properties.description: The Folder object for the folder that contains this file.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The file type as a four-character string.

properties.name: creator
properties.description: In Mac OS, the file creator as a four-character string. In Windows or UNIX, value is "????".

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: When true, the file is not shown in the platform-specific file browser.

properties.name: readonly
properties.description: When true, prevents the file from being altered or deleted.

properties.name: lineFeed
properties.description: How line feed characters are written in the file system.

properties.name: length
properties.description: The size of the file in bytes.

properties.name: encoding
properties.description: Gets or sets the encoding for subsequent read/write operations.

properties.name: eof
properties.description: When true, a read attempt caused the current position to be at the end of the file, or the file is not open.

methods.name: resolve
methods.description: Attempts to resolve the file-system alias or shortcut that this object refers to.

methods.name: rename
methods.description: Renames the associated file.

parameters.name: newName
parameters.description: The new file name, with no path information.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Deletes the file associated with this object from disk immediately, without moving it to the system trash.

methods.name: changePath
methods.description: Changes the path specification of the referenced file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A string containing the new path, absolute or relative to the current folder.

methods.name: getRelativeURI
methods.description: Retrieves and returns the path for this file, relative to the specified base path, in URI notation.

parameters.name: basePath
parameters.description: A base path in URI notation.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Executes or opens this file using the appropriate application, as if it had been double-clicked in a file browser.

methods.name: openDlg
methods.description: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, in which the user can select an existing file or files, and creates new File objects to represent the selected files.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: A string containing the prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.
A filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.
parameters.name: filter

parameters.description: When true, the user can select multiple files and the return value is an array.
parameters.name: multiSelect

methods.name: saveDlg
methods.description: Opens the built-in platform-specific file-browsing dialog, in which the user can select an existing file location to which to save information, and creates a new File object to represent the selected file.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: A string containing the prompt text, if the dialog allows a prompt.
In Windows only, a filter that limits the types of files displayed in the dialog.
parameters.name: filter

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Converts this object to a string.

methods.name: toSource
methods.description: Creates and returns a serialized string representation of this object.

methods.name: createAlias
methods.description: Makes this file a file-system alias or shortcut to the specified file.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: A string containing the path of the target file.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the referenced file for subsequent read/write operations. The method resolves any aliases to find the file.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The read-write mode, a single-character string.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: In Mac OS, the type of a newly created file, a 4-character string. Ignored in Windows and UNIX.

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: In Mac OS, the creator of a newly created file, a 4-character string. Ignored in Windows and UNIX.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes this open file.

methods.name: read
methods.description: Reads the contents of the file, starting at the current position.

parameters.name: chars
parameters.description: An integer specifying the number of characters to read.

methods.name: readch
methods.description: Reads a single text character from the file at the current position.

methods.name: readln
methods.description: Reads a single line of text from the file at the current position.

methods.name: write
methods.description: Writes the specified text to the file at the current position.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: A text string to be written.

methods.name: writeln
methods.description: Writes a string to the file at the current position and appends a line-feed sequence.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: A text string to be written.

methods.name: seek
methods.description: Seeks to a given position in the file.

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: The new current position in the file as an offset in bytes from the start, current position, or end, depending on the

methods.name: tell
methods.description: Retrieves the current position as a byte offset from the start of the file.

methods.name: copy
methods.description: Copies this object’s referenced file to the specified target location.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: A string with the URI path to the target location, or a File object that references the target location.

properties.name: fs
properties.description: The name of the file system.

description: Represents a file in the local file system in a platform-independent manner.
